overview: Over 2000 Union soldiers, passengers and crew were crammed aboard the steamboat Sultana, licensed to carry 376. Graft, greed, overcrowding, a poorly maintained boat, and the Mississippi River was swollen with spring snowmelt conspired together to create a disaster. On April 27, 1865, the boatâ€™s boilers exploded, causing the worst maritime disaster in US history.
tagline: The Sultana was a river boat that exploded in 1865 killing many passengers, mostly Union Soldiers.
title: Remember the Sultana
